page.title: 10Holywell Wood, Castleford
page.content: Once Holywell was a quarry for limestone. They had earlier dug mine tunnels for sandstone which was useful for making glass bottles. While they were digging they discovered a Roman burial site. There is a well in the woods which people used to think had holy water in. Now the derelict sandhills are used for BMX tracks. Trees had been destroyed in the 1985 miners strike to be used as fire wood. From Holywell on a clear day you can see Ferrybridge Power Station, Pontefract Park, and the Open Cast Site. In the Holywell wood there is wildlife like ants, spiders and wild strawberries.
